title: Kyle Sandilands reveals he failed to finish high school
text:
He might be one half of Australia's richest radio duo.

But Kyle Sandilands has revealed despite signing an $80 million deal to continue his KIIS FM show for another five years, the radio host failed to finish high school.

Talking to Channel Seven about his meteoric success, Kyle spoke of his humble beginnings and described himself as an 'uneducated Queensland kid'.

'You've just got to believe in yourself,' he said. 'Find something you're good at and if you have luck on your side, how can you go wrong?'

Kyle went on to explain he left school after failing to make it to the end of Year 10.

'I didn't finish junior certificate, so you are dealing with an 'uneducated Queensland kid,' he said.

Record breaking: Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson (pictured) are each set to earn $8 million annually for the next five years

But it seems Kyle's self-confessed lack of education has only spurred him on further.

He described the new $80 million contract he and Jackie 'O' Henderson have signed with ARN as 'the biggest media deal in Australian history'.

And Daily Mail Australia can reveal that is no exaggeration as the KIIS 106.5 stars now rank among the highest paid radio personalities in the world.

Kyle and Jackie are set to each earn $8 million annually for the next five years.

Meteoric: Kyle spoke of his humble beginnings and described himself as an 'uneducated Queensland kid'

Kyle, who confessed in his autobiography that he would regularly overspend in the early days of his radio career, is known for his luxury car collection and purchased a $1.3 million Rolls-Royce Phantom in July.

He had previously donated his older model to his girlfriend Imogen Anthony, who he has been dating since 2011.

She revealed the gift in 2016, saying: 'Kyle came to me the other day and said "Babe, Kendall [Jenner] got a Rolls for her birthday, so now it's too girly for me and I need something more masculine. I'm giving it to you."'

The 48-year-old shock jock reportedly has a collection of ten high-end vehicles, including a number of European sports cars.
description: He might be one half of Australia's richest radio duo.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
